business.headline: Karnataka vegetable vendor hit with Rs 29 lakh GST notice. Here's whySelling veggies for four years and accepting UPI has landed Shankargouda with a Rs 29 lakh GST notice on Rs 1.63 crore turnover.

Anthem Biosciences share price: Stock lists at 27% premium on market debutAnthem Biosciences stock price: The company's shares opened at Rs 723.05 on the NSE and Rs 723.10 on the BSE. This was about 27% higher than its issue price of Rs 570.

Burger Singh debunks Rs 47 crore funding claim with viral statementIn a statement that's equal parts denial and stand-up comedy set, the homegrown burger chain responded to reports that it had secured a Rs 47.15 crore investment round, calling the claims premature, misleading, and just plain wrong—at least for now.
Sensex opens flat, Nifty below 25,000; RIL falls 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 130.29 points to 81,627.44, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 48.95 points to 24,919.45 as of 9:22 am.

CoinDCX loses $44 million in cyberattack: Here's what the crypto platform saidThis is the second large-scale hack involving an Indian crypto exchange in the past year. In July 2024, WazirX lost $234 million when one of its wallets hosted on Liminal was compromised.

Anthem Biosciences IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPAnthem Biosciences share price: The IPO opened for subscription between July 14 and July 16, and was subscribed 67.42 times in total. Highest demand came from qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), who bid 192.80 times the reserved portion.

Standard not met: What Astronomer said on CEO Andy Byron's Coldplay kiss cam rowAstronomer responded to the viral video by placing CEO Andy Byron on leave, later confirming his resignation after stating that leadership standards had not been met. The company emphasised its commitment to accountability and the core values it was founded on.
India's rich are swapping gold for bitcoin. Here's WhyNow-a-days more of India's rich are putting a slice of their gold-backed wealth into shiny new digital coins like Bitcoin.

Astronomer CEO Andy Byron quits after Coldplay kiss cam scandalDataOps firm Astronomer's CEO, Andy Byron, has resigned following a scandal at a Coldplay concert which also involved the firm's HR head, Kristen Cabot. In a statement, the company announced the board of directors had accepted the resignation, stating that "the company's standard wasn't met." The New York-based unicorn company, founded in 2018, confirmed that a search for a new CEO is underway. The resignation followed a board-initiated investigation after an incident at a Coldplay event involving the CEO went viral. The board said that leaders are expected to set the standard in conduct and accountability. There has been no official update regarding any action taken against the HR head, Kristen Cabot, who is the Chief People's Officer at the company.

Andy Byron, Astronomer CEO caught in Coldplay kiss cam scandal, resignsAndy Byron resigns as CEO of AI firm Astronomer after a viral 'kiss cam' video with HR chief Kristin Cabot sparked online speculation and prompted an internal review by the company.

Career, kids and a cause: Shloka Ambani shares what keeps her goingIn a heart-to-heart on Masoom Minawala's podcast, Shloka opened up about her journey—balancing kids, career, and a cause she truly believes in.

Astronomer CEO, HR head sent on leave after Coldplay kiss cam outs 'affair'The company issued an official statement two days after the incident, announcing that its board had initiated an internal investigation.

entertainment.headline: Karan Johar shuts down troll calling him 'nepo kid ka daijaan' for praising SaiyaaraFilmmaker Karan Johar defended his review of 'Saiyaara' against criticism. A troll had labelled him as the nanny of nepo kids in the comment section of his post. The film marks the debut of actors Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda on the big screen.

Rishab Shetty calls Kantara divine force as he wraps up shoot. Glimpse outActor-director Rishab Shetty wrapped up the shooting of 'Kantara - Chapter 1'. The makers unveiled a behind-the-scenes glimpse of the world of Kantara.

Saiyaara box office Day 3: YRF's film beats Kabir Singh for biggest romantic weekendAhaan Panday and Aneet Padda's 'Saiyaara' has emerged as the most loved Bollywood romantic drama in a long time. The tickets are selling like hot cakes and there seems no stopping this YRF biggie at the box office now.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi... BTS video hints at original cast's return with Smriti IraniThe makers of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' have shared a behind-the-scenes (BTS) video on social media. The video hints at the return of the original cast, along with actor Smriti Irani.  It featured actors Shakti Anand, Ritu Seth, Hiten Tejwani and Gauri Pradhan.

Baahubali team spoofs viral Coldplay couple moment with Prabhas-Anushka's picThe 'Baahubali' team joined the meme fest on Coldplay's viral kiss cam controversy. It featured actors Prabhas and Anushka Shetty as "CEO & HR of Maahishmathi".

Ram Charan celebrates wife Upasana's birthday with grand gesture. See picRam Charan celebrated his entrepreneur-wife Upasana Kamineni's birthday with the cutest gesture. He shared a photo of them, along with their daughter, Klin Kaara.

Coldplay's Chris Martin issues cheeky warning following viral kiss cam incidentAfter the viral kiss cam controversy accidentally outing Astronomer CEO's affair, Coldplay lead singer Chris Martin playfully warned the concert-goers to be camera-ready. His remark came at the band's subsequent performance at Camp Randall Stadium in Madison, Martin.

Ajith Kumar's car crashes at Italy race, actor helps clean up debris. WatchActor Ajith Kumar's car crashed at Misano during the GT4 European Series. Although uninjured, the actor was seen helping the staff clean up the debris on the racetrack.

Saiyaara craze hits the roof as man watches film in theatre with IV drip. WatchSaiyaara, featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has been ruling the theatres ever since it hit theatres. The craze for the film rose sky-high as a man watched the film in a theatre with an IV drip in his hand.

Is Mohit Suri's Saiyaara copy of a Korean film? Internet thinks soMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara', featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, hit cinemas on Friday. Soon after its release, viewers began drawing attention to noticeable similarities with a Korean film.

Band karo: Amitabh Bachchan loses patience with paps for filming outside JalsaAmitabh Bachchan was seen scolding paparazzi outside his home, Jalsa for filming his house. Take a look at the viral video.

Amitabh Bachchan mourns dear friend and Don director Chandra Barot's deathAmitabh Bachchan paid heartfelt tribute to his director-friend, Chandra Barot. They worked together in the cult classic 'Don'.

Parineeti-Raghav leave Kapil's shoot midway after politician's mother falls illParineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha's debut appearance on Kapil Sharma's show was unexpectedly halted due to a medical emergency involving Raghav's mother. The couple reportedly had to leave the show mid-shoot to visit the hospital.

Anirudh Ravichander's Chennai concert postponed over overwhelming ticket demandSinger-composer Anirudh Ravichander postponed his Chennai concert due to overwhelming ticket demand. He was scheduled to perform on July 26 at Thiruvidanthai.

Between Kapil Sharma and Gong Yoo: Vir Das's Fool Volume debuts strong on NetflixVir Das humourously celebrated his Netflix special 'Fool Volume', debuting at Number 3 in India, sandwiched between popular shows 'The Great Indian Kapil Show' and 'Squid Game: Season 3'. He shared a fun AI image caught between Kapil Sharma and Gong Yoo.

Rajamouli, wife Rama enjoy Brad Pitt's F1 at Hyderabad's Prasads theatre. WatchFilmmaker SS Rajamouli was captured watching actor Brad Pitt's 'F1 The Movie'. Videos of him leaving the theatres went viral.

Mamata Banerjee wishes speedy recovery to brother Shah Rukh Khan after injuryWest Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee expressed concern for Shah Rukh Khan's injury during 'King' shoot. He is currently in the UK recovering.

Nothing brings Nick Jonas more joy than celebrating Priyanka, his new post has it allPop star Nick Jonas penned a heartfelt birthday tribute for his wife, Priyanka Chopra, accompanied by a romantic photo. The couple, who have been married since 2018, continue to serve major relationship goals.
Don director Chandra Barot dies at 86, Farhan Akhtar pays tributeVeteran filmmaker Chandra Barot died at the age of 86. He was best known for his work in Amitabh Bachchan's 'Don'.

general news.headline: Fighting political battles, being misused: ED faces Supreme Court ire in 2 casesThe Supreme Court came down heavily on the ED and issued strong observations on two matters - one involving an appeal against relief granted to Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's wife in the MUDA case, and the other a suo motu hearing on ED summons to lawyers for advice given to clients.

2006 Mumbai train blasts: All 12 convicts, including 5 on death row, acquittedNearly two decades after the 2006 Mumbai train bombings killed 189 people, the Bombay High Court has acquitted all 12 men convicted in the case, citing unreliable evidence and forced confessions.

Proceedings of both houses resume, Opposition MPs continue protestParliament's Monsoon session beginning today promises high drama, with the opposition gearing up to target the government over a flurry of contentious issues - from US President Trump's claims of mediating a ceasefire with Pakistan and alleged lapses in the deadly Pahalgam attack, to the Bihar voter list revision and the Air India crash that killed 260. While the government is set to push forward with 17 bills, including a resistance to Congress's demand for restoring J&K statehood, the session - the first since Operation Sindoor - is expected to be stormy. PM Modi will open proceedings with a statement outlining the Centre's priorities amid rising pressure to respond to both domestic and international concerns.

Nitish Reddy out of remaining Tests, Anshul Kamboj added to India squadIndia all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been ruled out of the remainder of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy and will take no further part in the last two Tests against England.

Nimisha Priya isn't off the hook, but politics of credit has peakedKerala nurse Nimisha Priya's execution in Yemen has been deferred after intervention by Sheikh Abubakr Ahmad Musliyar, the Grand Mufti of India. Her fate, however, remains uncertain. Meanwhile, a battle, political in nature, over the Musliyar hogging credit for the reprieve has erupted in Kerala.

Monsoon session will celebrate victory of soldiers in Op Sindoor, says PM Modi Live updatesThe Prime Minister touched upon a host of issues, ranging from India setting foot on the space station to the government's resolve of a 'Naxalism-free' country by 2026.
Supreme Court orders CBI probe into 'custodial torture' of J&K constableThe petitioner had alleged that he was brutally tortured and mutilated while in custody at the Kupwara interrogation facility.
Faith call in Tamil Nadu: Should temple funds build colleges?An old debate about state control of temples heats up with political rhetoric in the poll-bound state.

Why carrying your own cup while travelling can protect you from microplasticsIf you usually drink tea or coffee from a paper cup, it's a good idea to start using your own cup. Tejaswini AnanthKumar, who leads the Board of Governors at the Indian Institute of Engineering Science and Technology (IIEST), recently shared a post asking people to carry their own cups when they travel.
SSVM Institutions: From Cradle to CosmosForging Futures with Foresight, Flair, and Faith

Elon Musk says he is back to 7-day workweeks, sleeping in office as "wartime CEO"Elon Musk has resumed his extreme work schedule. The billionaire in his recent post on the X reveals that he is working seven days a week amid high-pressure demands across his companies.

Odisha Congress student leader arrested for lacing woman's drink, raping herThe survivor said that the accused lavished her drink with sedatives, raped her at a hotel and later threatened her with dire consequences.

Obama handcuffed, put in jail: Trump posts AI video amid poll fraud chargeThe video comes after the Trump administration accused Obama of election fraud in 2016, with the US President backing calls for his prosecution.

Stranded F-35 in Kerala fixed, set for trial flight today before UK return: SourcesThe stranded British F-35 fighter jet in Kerala has been repaired, said sources. It is expected to move out of the hangar today for a trial sortie. Next steps on its return to the UK depend on trial results.

Kerala woman found dead in UAE, family alleges dowry harrasment by husbandThe Kerala police registered a case against a man for the murder of his wife, Athulya, who was found dead in the UAE. The complaint was filed by her mother, and her family alleged dowry harassment and violent abuse.
Lid blows off excise scam in Jharkhand: What's brewing?Rs 38 crore lost, the scam has exposed a network of forged guarantees, policy manipulation and bureaucratic connivance

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi... BTS video hints at original cast's return with Smriti IraniThe makers of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' have shared a behind-the-scenes (BTS) video on social media. The video hints at the return of the original cast, along with actor Smriti Irani.  It featured actors Shakti Anand, Ritu Seth, Hiten Tejwani and Gauri Pradhan.

Torture, unreliable witnesses: Why 2006 Mumbai train blast convicts walked freeNearly 19 years after the train blasts that killed 189, the Bombay High Court has acquitted all 12 convicts, citing torture, unreliable witnesses and botched evidence.

India vs Pakistan in WCL semi-final? Team owner lifts the lid on possible clashIndia and Pakistan will continue to avoid facing each other in the semi-final of the World Championship of Legends (WCL) 2025 after the league fixture between the two teams got cancelled.

Astronomer HR head's 2024 pic with husband, kids goes viral amid kiss cam scandalA picture from May 2024, originally shared by a family member who goes by the name Maud Cabot on Facebook, shows Kristin Cabot beaming next to Privateer Rum CEO Andrew Cabot and two young children.

Who can rescue Indian football? Top contenders to take over as head coachA coach quits, rankings tumble, and club football's on pause—Indian football's in another freefall. The next head coach appointment won't just plug gaps; it could define whether Vision 2047 is dream fuel or dust.

More goons than Shiv devotees in Kanwar Yatra: Samajwadi MLA amid assault casesSambhal MLA Iqbal Mehmood urged the Uttar Pradesh government to take action against the miscreants and send them to jail.

'ISIS-style' conversion gang busted in Agra: Girls forced into Islam, radicalisedA suspected ISIS-inspired syndicate in Uttar Pradesh's Agra allegedly targeted Hindu girls for religious conversion using brainwashing, suspected Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) funding and fake identities.
IndiGo flight to Hyderabad suffers glitch, circles for 40 minutes before returnIn a separate incident earlier in the day, flight 6E 2696 on the same route also faced a similar issue.

Karan Johar shuts down troll calling him 'nepo kid ka daijaan' for praising SaiyaaraFilmmaker Karan Johar defended his review of 'Saiyaara' against criticism. A troll had labelled him as the nanny of nepo kids in the comment section of his post. The film marks the debut of actors Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda on the big screen.

The tickets are selling like hot cakes and there seems no stopping this YRF biggie at the box office now.

sports.headline: All-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy ruled out of Test series due to knee injuryDeepening India's injury crisis, all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy has been ruled out of the remaining two Tests against England.

Who can rescue Indian football? Top contenders to take over as head coachA coach quits, rankings tumble, and club football's on pause—Indian football's in another freefall. The next head coach appointment won't just plug gaps; it could define whether Vision 2047 is dream fuel or dust.

Not Rohit or Kohli, Gavaskar finds ideal comparison of Shubman Gill's captaincyFormer India cricketer turned commentator has compared Shubman Gill with India's previous victorious captains in England. Gill has had a tough beginning to his captaincy tenure as India are trailing by 1-2 in the ongoing five-match series against England.

Sai Sudharsan was my no. 3, didn't agree with Karun's backing: Sanjay ManjrekarFormer India cricketer-turned commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has suggested bringing back Sai Sudharsan for the fourth Test against England in place of Karun Nair.

I love India: Brett Lee reacts to India-Pakistan champions clash cancellationFormer Australian pacer Brett Lee has broken his silence following the cancellation of the India vs Pakistan encounter in the World Championship of Legends tournament.

Rishabh Pant is the backbone of the Indian Test team: Suresh RainaFormer India batter Suresh Raina has described wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as the backbone of the Indian Test team. Pant has amassed 425 runs at an impressive average of 70.83 in the series so far, making him the second-highest run-scorer behind captain Shubman Gill. "Rishabh Pant is the backbone of the Indian Test team. The way he bats, the way he keeps on chirping from behind the stumps to disturb the opposition batters," Raina told India Today.

Venus Williams returns to tennis, hopes sister Serena will also join the funVenus Williams is hoping her sister Serena will follow her back onto the court, as the 45-year-old prepares to make her return to professional tennis at the Washington Open as a wildcard entrant.

India vs Pakistan in WCL semi-final? Team owner lifts the lid on possible clashIndia and Pakistan will continue to avoid facing each other in the semi-final of the World Championship of Legends (WCL) 2025 after the league fixture between the two teams got cancelled.

1st T20I: Green, Owen help Australia take 1-0 series lead in West IndiesAustralia drew first blood in the T20I series against the West Indies, clinching a thrilling three-wicket victory in Kingstown on Sunday to take a 1-0 lead in the five-match contest.

Pakistan head coach slams pitch after crushing defeat vs Bangladesh in 1st T20IPakistan head coach Mike Hesson has slammed the Dhaka pitch following his team's horrendous batting performance in the first T20I vs Bangladesh, which led to a seven-wicket defeat.

ICC provides update on displaced Afghan women cricketers' initiativeThe displaced women cricketers from Afghanistan, who fled their country due to Taliban rule, will receive key engagement opportunities during the next two global events, the ICC said during its annual conference on Sunday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
